ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned some good molecular dynamics skills as well as some ways to think about biophysics
Coding and soft matter.
We learned various methodologies for modelling biological processes. We also developed interesting ways to analyze biological systems.
I gained a greater insight into how simulations are run and common simulation practices.
Matlab.

I learned about molecular dynamics and the different types of models used for modeling  biological physics and the implementation through MATLAB computer software. I learned about the vertex model for cells.
Learned more about packing and proteins and molecular dynamics, and doing simulations in matlab.
Learned how to theoretically think and decompose biophysical problems and computationally model and study these systems
Principles in maths and physics, MATLAB basics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
It was pretty hands on which was fun, and good for soaking up the material.

It was a bit hard to follow towards the end however.
Well organized. Learned a lot.

The strengths of this course were that the project based model of the class is good for learning of useful skills. However the biggest weakness of this class is that it was not actually a biophysics class. This class was what I would have expected from the computation methods in biology course. There was very little theory or biological concepts being taught. It was mostly a computation course which was not what I signed up for. In many ways it was Biophysics as used in the O'Hern's research instead of biophysics that might be applicable to all students. A majority of the students in the class work for Professor O'Hern and it often felt as if the class was being taught for them and not the rest of the class. 

Truthfully I feel like what might be the most useful improvement of the course is to split it in to those with biology background and those with out. A complaint that has been brought many times this course is taught is that the physics is too low level for physicists/engineers/etc. and overwhelming for the biologists. And furthermore the non-biologists don't actually gain much insight in to biology from this course either.
The course starting off great with statistical mechanics and polymer dynamics, but near the end started to feel a little disorganized.

We only had 6 homework sets, which made my engagement very on/off. I think a more consistent workload would be very helpful. The homework sets were interesting and cool to do, but they sometimes had errors or were hard to understand. Also, I feel like I didn't need to understand the lectures to do the homework most of the time.
Great matlab instruction.

The strengths is that you get a lot of hands on experience with MATLAB coding which seems very practical. However, I did not have as much biology background as some of the other students so maybe it would have been nice if there was some more context provided. Or if a suggested text book reading could be posted for each topic, that may have been helpful.

Strengths - assignments had interesting, visual results

Weaknesses - assignments frequently had typos or unclear instructions that made it a guessing game and often frustrating. Skills needed for the assignment were often separate from lecture topics. Second half of course lectures were less about course topics and mostly about prof's own research.
Very hard
The problems presented in this course were novel to someone who had not taken this course or worked in the professor's group. Nice introduction to the field and the mode of thinking utilized.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes,. Well organized. Learned a lot.
I would recommend the course if the student hasn't taken integrated workshop, as there is some overlap of material, but I would recommend either integrated workshop or biophysics.
Great course for matlab introduction.
Yes, the problem sets walk you through some very cool concepts.
I would recommend this course. It was overall a fun and interesting class.
Nope
Yes. It is exactly Biological Physics and you finish with new skills, or at lease new ways of applying those skills.
